「災害・景気」で補正予算…首相、経済対策指示へ

07 Nov 2019, 13:13

　安倍首相は７日、大規模な災害対策や国内景気の下支えを図ることなどを目的に、新しい経済対策の策定を近く指示する考えを明らかにした。８日にも正式に指示し、必要な対策費を政府の２０１９年度補正予算と２０年度の当初予算に盛り込む方針だ。
　首相は７日の経済財政諮問会議で、台風などの自然災害や海外経済のリスクの高まり、１０月の消費増税の影響を挙げ、「時機を逸することなく、先を見据えたマクロ経済政策を講じていくことの重要性を強く感じており、今、何をなすべきか判断したい」と述べた。
　会議では、今年に入って世界の経済成長率の見通しの下方修正が続いているほか、国内でも製造業を中心とした企業の景況感や、消費者心理が悪化していることなどが報告された。台風や豪雨でも大きな被害が出ている。
　首相は、日本経済が回復基調にあるとの認識を示す一方、「十分な留意が必要な状況にあることを改めて認識した」と語った。今秋の台風や豪雨の被害を念頭に、「政府として、必要な防災・減災・国土強靱（きょうじん）化の取り組みをしっかりと強化する」とも述べた。
　政府が経済対策を策定するのは１６年８月以来、約３年ぶりとなる。台風１９号など相次ぐ自然災害に対する防災力の強化や、消費増税の経済対策の拡充、米国と中国の貿易摩擦の影響を受けている日本企業の支援などが柱になる見通しで、１９年度補正予算と２０年度当初予算に反映させる方針だ。

Supplementary budget for "disaster / economy" ... Prime Minister, to economic measures instructions

07 Nov 2019, 13:13

On the 7th, Prime Minister Abe clarified the idea that he would soon instruct the formulation of new economic measures with the aim of supporting large-scale disaster countermeasures and the domestic economy. It will be officially instructed on the 8th, and the necessary measures will be incorporated into the government's FY2019 supplementary budget and the initial budget for FY2008.
Prime Minister said at the economic and financial advisory meeting on the 7th that natural disasters such as typhoons and the risk of overseas economies increased, the impact of the consumption tax increase in October, “ I strongly feel the importance of taking it and want to judge what to do now. "
The conference reported that the global economic growth rate forecast has been revised downward this year, and that business sentiment, particularly in the manufacturing industry, is also worsening in Japan and consumer sentiment has deteriorated. It was. The typhoon and heavy rain are also causing serious damage.
“The Prime Minister said that he was recognizing that the Japanese economy is on a recovery track, and that he“ recognized that there is a need for sufficient attention ”. With the typhoon and heavy rain this fall in mind, he said, “The government will strengthen the necessary disaster prevention, mitigation, and national resilience efforts.”
The government will formulate economic measures for the first time in three years since August 2016. The supplementary budget for FY19 is expected to become the pillars of strengthening disaster prevention capabilities against successive natural disasters such as Typhoon No. 19, expanding economic measures to increase consumption taxes, and supporting Japanese companies affected by trade friction between the US and China. The policy is to reflect it in the initial budget for FY2008.
